function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Cultural resistance to new approaches","category":"Cultural and Lifestyle Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Resistance to living systems thinking and the additional up-front time needed to engage stakeholder input and commitment can impede the adoption of regenerative development and design practices.","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Diversity in social and economic equity, demographics, and proximity to services create spatial heterogeneity in urban and suburban areas, impacting disease propagation patterns.","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased garden usage associated with better health outcomes","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Association between garden usage and anxiety related to covid-19","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Older adults spending more time in the garden during covid-19 lockdown reported better health and wellbeing","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of evidence on the impact of ’nature’ of garden activity gardening or relaxing on wellbeing during the pandemic","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inequality in access to green space and nature","category":"Access to infrastructure  ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of physical activity among older adults","category":"Physical activity and mobility","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negative spatial perception and mental health effects due to poor housing quality","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of spatial flexibility and independent supplies in dwellings","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of stable access to resources for telework and daily living","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate storage and space for domestic tasks leading to overcrowding and lack of essential space","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited access to open-air spaces and nature contact leading to reduced well-being of occupants","category":"Access to infrastructure  ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate public support and interest in nature conservation and pcas","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate engagement of local communities in conservation efforts","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of the term ’social murder’ and structural ’violence turn’ in housing studies","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Social inequality, housing inequalities, and health inequalities","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of displacement pressure on health-harming behaviors","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Prolonged exposure to social harms in housing","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fluid and conflated spaces due to covid-19 lockdowns","category":"Communication and Messaging","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inequality in housing and health","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Narratives against mask-wearing and vaccination during the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Disinformation and Misinformation","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Home as a place where social harms are stored and amplified during lockdowns","category":"Social and Psychological Effects ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of focus on social inequality, health, and housing.","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unexplored concepts such as social murder, ontological security, and home un-making.","category":"Social and Psychological Effects ","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of recognition of social harm perspective as a building block for housing studies.","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High dependence on migrant workers in the construction sector","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased labor working hours without addressing labor concerns","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased workload on blue-collar workers due to the need for facility management services and creating a safer workplace for workers","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of inclusion of human health in the definition of Compliance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social and economic consequences of implementing public health measures","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of explicit inclusion of equity considerations in the literature review may perpetuate health disparities and lead to unequal access to healthcare resources.","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective enforcement of mandatory face mask use, leading to reduced compliance and increased risk of disease transmission in public transportation Compliance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate engagement of diverse communities in pandemic planning","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate coverage of Compliance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Historically, pandemics have always had an impact on architecture.","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Human fear of infectious diseases has led to the emergence of artificial environments.","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased outdoor activities can lead to closer
